drug.name: ZEN-012
drug.description: ZEN-012 is a novel small molecule and the first anti-cancer drug in development involving two mechanisms of action: tubulin and topoisomerase II inhibition. ZEN-012 also expresses additional modes of action such as pro-apoptotic and anti-angiogenic properties. It is developed for the treatment of solid tumors.
drug.pharmacodynamics:
In vitro: ZEN-012 has shown potent in vitro anti-proliferative activity at nanomolar concentrations against human tumor cell lines of different origin. ZEN-012 is active in tumor cell lines which are resistant to cisplatin and doxorubicin as well as to tubulin inhibitors such as vincristine and paclitaxel. Furthermore, it was shown thatZEN-012 is a catalytic inhibitor of the enzyme topoisomerase II with the same potency as amsacrine.
In vivo: Given orally once or twice weekly, ZEN-012 proved to be a potent inhibitor of in vivo tumor growth in mammary, lung, renal, colon, melanoma xenograft models as well as in leukemia cancer models at well tolerated doses (16-40mg/kg). Furthermore,ZEN-012 showed good safety and toxicity profiles in a series of rodent and non-rodent studies.
drug.mechanism-of-action: Mode of action studies revealed that the compound ZEN-012 inhibits the polymerization of ÃŸ-tubulin in low micromolar concentrations. Competition studies suggest that ZEN-012 interacts with the same binding site on microtubules as colchicine. ZEN-012 destroys the mitotic spindles of the cancer cells, arrests the cancer cells in G2/M phase at low concentrations, mediates DNA fragmentation via inhibition of topoisomerase II and induces apoptosis via various mechanisms.

polypeptide.name: Tubulin beta chain
polypeptide.specific-function: Tubulin is the major constituent of microtubules. It binds two moles of GTP, one at an exchangeable site on the beta chain and one at a non-exchangeable site on the alpha chain.

go-classifier.description: G2/M transition of mitotic cell cycle
movement of cell or subcellular component

polypeptide.name: Tubulin beta-1 chain
polypeptide.specific-function: Tubulin is the major constituent of microtubules. It binds two moles of GTP, one at an exchangeable site on the beta chain and one at a non-exchangeable site on the alpha chain (By similarity).

polypeptide.name: Tubulin beta-3 chain
polypeptide.specific-function: Tubulin is the major constituent of microtubules. It binds two moles of GTP, one at an exchangeable site on the beta chain and one at a non-exchangeable site on the alpha chain. TUBB3 plays a critical role in proper axon guidance and mantainance.

polypeptide.name: Tubulin beta-4A chain
polypeptide.specific-function: Tubulin is the major constituent of microtubules. It binds two moles of GTP, one at an exchangeable site on the beta chain and one at a non-exchangeable site on the alpha chain.

go-classifier.description: G2/M transition of mitotic cell cycle

polypeptide.name: DNA topoisomerase 2-alpha
polypeptide.specific-function: Control of topological states of DNA by transient breakage and subsequent rejoining of DNA strands. Topoisomerase II makes double-strand breaks. Essential during mitosis and meiosis for proper segregation of daughter chromosomes. May play a role in regulating the period length of ARNTL/BMAL1 transcriptional oscillation (By similarity).

go-classifier.description: cellular response to DNA damage stimulus
DNA unwinding involved in DNA replication
positive regulation of single stranded viral RNA replication via double stranded DNA intermediate
positive regulation of transcription from RNA polymerase II promoter
positive regulation of viral genome replication

polypeptide.name: DNA topoisomerase 2-beta
polypeptide.specific-function: Control of topological states of DNA by transient breakage and subsequent rejoining of DNA strands. Topoisomerase II makes double-strand breaks.

go-classifier.description: DNA unwinding involved in DNA replication
